page.title: 18THE DEER FARM,WITHERNSEA
page.content: My father owns a deer farm near Withernsea.The animals,all red deer, are kept on 22 acres of land split into 5 paddocks.There are 60 hinds and 27 stags and this year 53 calves have been born.When born they hide in the grass,just as they would in the wild, to protect themselves from enemies. We have to find them quickly to weigh them and put an identification tag in their ear before they become too difficult to catch! The deer mate in autumn and the calves are born in summer. During the winter the deer are put indoors and fed on nuts,hay and silage. During the summer they are put out to graze. The stags lose their antlers in winter, but grow them again in the autumn ready for the rutting or mating season. Howard Drescher.
